instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

Working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> come my desk not green light problem. Some one tried fix board . No voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> nothing changed.
After removed F7040 [U]green light come back[/U], then i inject 12.5V <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line fan spin 3 sec. than stop loop .

Note: When i connected battery green or orange light not come only battery disconnected green light turns on.

Now where can i check next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: F7040 pin 1 is 12,5V when removed fuse. But when put back fuse no green light. ( No short a ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27//28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Voltage on pin 2?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: 17/18 resistance is 3.4Ohm , 27/28 resistance is 22Ohm . Pin 2 is 14.8V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message:
Hello again
After replacement <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> green light is ok and put back F7040. ( Also battery charging turn light orange ) but still power turn on off loop continue :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> should be 20 ohm, check if it is correct....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: oh wait, is your charger original 85W???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: On/off does not spell anything good. Was the ROM messed with? Inspect for missing components. Could be many things.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message:
Yes original 85W charger (tested 17" Macbook PRO without battery its runs ).

Re flash SPI but nothing changed :( 

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3v stable , <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v  ( when 3.3V fan spins) 1 sec. later turns 0V maybe give any idea about next step

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: The board was messed with so at this point it can be anything. CPU Vcore coming on when the fan spins?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message:
Yes know its could be anythings but spend too much time and now want to solve problem...

No CPU VCore Duke

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power on & off loop
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> power good line coming high when fan spins? If not one of the power rails is missing.
